data.title: Comoros
data.text:

ããComoros

ããï¼Updated February 2018ï¼

ãããOfficial NameãUnion of Comoros

ãããAreaã2,236 kã¡

ãããPopulationãAbout 800,000 (2017). The country is mainly composed of Arab descendants, Cafre, Makoas, and Sakalava. Comorian is the commonly used language, and the official languages are Comorian, French, and Arabic. More than 95% of residents believe in Islam (mainly Sunni).

ãããCapitalãMoroni, with a population of about 60,000. The hot season is from November to May, with an average temperature of 24 to 31â; and the cool season is June to October, with an average temperature of 19 to 27â.

ãããHead of StateãPresident Azali Assoumani took office in May 2016.

ãããHolidaysãNational Day (6 July)

ãããGeography and ClimateãAn island country in the West Indian Ocean and located at the northern mouth of the Mozambique Channel, Comoros is about 300 kilometers from Madagascar to the east and about 300 kilometers fromMozambique to the west. With a tropical oceanic climate, the average annual temperature is 23 to 28â.
